subject: Football
Concussions
lead_paragraph: Chicago defensive end Julius Peppers was fined $10,000 by the N.F.L. for a helmet-to-helmet hit on Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers in the N.F.C. championship game that drew blood from Rodgers.
snippet: Chicago defensive end Julius Peppers was fined $10,000 by the N.F.L. for a helmet-to-helmet hit on Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers in the N.F.C. championship game that drew blood from Rodgers.
